com.software.reuze

Class a_Problem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.a_Problem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    apm_ProblemBidirectional

    public class a_Problem
extends Object
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 66.

    A problem can be defined formally by five components:
    • The initial state that the agent starts in.
    • A description of the possible actions available to the agent. Given a particular state s, ACTIONS(s) returns the set of actions that can be executed in s.
    • A description of what each action does; the formal name for this is the transition model, specified by a function RESULT(s, a) that returns the state that results from doing action a in state s.
    • The goal test, which determines whether a given state is a goal state.
    • A path cost function that assigns a numeric cost to each path. The problem-solving agent chooses a cost function that reflects its own performance measure. The step cost of taking action a in state s to reach state s' is denoted by c(s,a,s')
    Author:
    Ravi Mohan, Ciaran O'Reilly, Mike Stampone

    • Constructor Detail

      • a_Problem

        public a_Problem(Object initialState,
         aa_i_ActionsFunction actionsFunction,
         aa_i_ActionResultFunction resultFunction,
         a_i_GoalTest goalTest)
        Constructs a problem with the specified components, and a default step cost function (i.e. 1 per step).
        Parameters:
        initialState - the initial state that the agent starts in.
        actionsFunction - a description of the possible actions available to the agent.
        resultFunction - a description of what each action does; the formal name for this is the transition model, specified by a function RESULT(s, a) that returns the state that results from doing action a in state s.
        goalTest - test determines whether a given state is a goal state.

        Constructs a problem with the specified components, which includes a step cost function.
        Parameters:
        initialState - the initial state of the agent.
        actionsFunction - a description of the possible actions available to the agent.
        resultFunction - a description of what each action does; the formal name for this is the transition model, specified by a function RESULT(s, a) that returns the state that results from doing action a in state s.
        goalTest - test determines whether a given state is a goal state.
        stepCostFunction - a path cost function that assigns a numeric cost to each path. The problem-solving-agent chooses a cost function that reflects its own performance measure.
